abstract: Global miner Rio Tinto said it had held talks to sell some assets to Chinese government-owned aluminum maker Chinalco, its biggest shareholder, reportedly to cut debt by up to $8 billion.
lead_paragraph: Global miner Rio Tinto said it had held talks to sell some assets to Chinese government-owned aluminum maker Chinalco, its biggest shareholder, reportedly to cut debt by up to $8 billion.

headline.main: Rio In Asset Sale Talks With Chinalco
